direction.raw_text: Throw me the rope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll wait until you're ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again. Thank you. The Man In Black sits to rest on the boulder that once held the rope. He tugs off his leather boots and is amazed to see several large rocks tumble out. The Man In Black wears gloves. Inigo stares at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not mean to pry, but you don't by any chance happen to have six fingers on your right hand? He glances up -- the question clearly baffles him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you always begin conversations this way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My father was slaughtered by a sixfingered man. He was a great swordmaker, my father. And when the six-fingered man appeared and requested a special sword, my father took the job. He slaved a year before he was done. He hands his sword to the Man In Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fondling it-impressed) I have never seen its equal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The six-fingered man returned and demanded it, but at one-tenth his promised price. My father refused. Without a word, the six-fingered man slashed him through the heart. I loved my father, so, naturally, challenged his murderer to a duel ... I failed ... (MORE) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the six-fingered man did leave me alive with the six-fingered sword, but he gave me these. He touches his scars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was eleven years old. When I was strong enough, I dedicated my life to the study of fencing. So the next time we meet, I will not fail. I will go up to the sixfingered man and say, "Hello, my name is Inigo Montoya. You killed my father. Prepare to die."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've done nothing but study swordplay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More pursuit than study lately. You see, I cannot find him. It's been twenty years now. I am starting to lose confidence. I just work for Vizzini to pay the bills. There's not a lot of money in revenge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing back the great sword, starting to rise) Well, I certainly hope you find him, someday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are ready, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You seem a decent fellow. I hate to kill you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (walking away a few paces, unsheathing his sword) You seem a decent fellow. I hate to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Begin! And on that word -- CUT TO: THE TWO OF THEM And what we are starting now is one of the two greatest sword fights in modern movies (the other one happens later on), and right from the beginning it looks different. Because they aren't close to each other -- none of the swordscrossing "en garde" garbage. No, what we have here is two men, two athletes, and they look to be too faraway to damage each other, but each time one makes even the tiniest feint, the other counters, and there is silence, and as they start to circle -- CUT TO: THE SIX-FINGERED SWORD feinting here, feinting there and -- CUT TO: THE TWO MEN finished teasing, begin to duel in earnest. Their swords cross, then again, again, and the sound comes so fast it's almost continual. Inigo presses on, the Man In Black retreating up a rocky incline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought it fitting, considering the rocky terrain -- INIGO Naturally, you must expect me to attack with Capo Ferro. And he shifts his style now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (coping as best he can)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO He watches them depart, then turns, peers down over the Cliffs. He watches a moment, then paces, shaking his hands loose. He practices a few of his honed fencing skills. He is a taut and nervous fellow, and has never been one for waiting around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO walking away. Finally he goes back to cliff edge, starts to talk. It's instant death if the Man In Black falls, but neither gives that possibility much credence. This is our two heroes meeting. They don't know it yet; but that's what it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO He dashes to the giant rock the rope was originally tied to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK as his grip loosens a moment, trying to cling to the side of the cliff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO now with a small coil of rope, hurries back to the edge and hurls it over -- CUT TO: THE ROPE It hangs close to the Man In Black. He releases the rocks, grabs the rope, hangs helplessly in space a moment, then looks up at Inigo and -- CUT TO: INIGO straining, forcing his body away from the cliff edge and -- CUT TO: THE MAN IN BLACK rising through the early morning light, slowly, steadily, and as the cliff top at last comes within reach -- CUT TO: INIGO watching as the Man In Black crawls to safety, then looks to Inigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : CLOSE UP - INIGO Even now, this still brings pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK looking up at Inigo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: naturally -- (suddenly shifting again) --but I find Thibault cancels out Capo Ferro, don't you? The Man In Black is now perched at the edge of the elevated castle ruin. No where to go, he jumps to the sand. Inigo stares down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless the enemy has studied his Agrippa- And now, with the grace of an Olympian, Inigo flies off the perch, somersaults clean over the Man In Black's head, and lands facing his opponent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which I have. The two men are almost flying across the rocky terrain, never losing balance, never coming close to stumbling; the battle rages with incredible finesse, first one and then the other gaining the advantage, and by now, it's clear that this isn't just two athletes going at it, it's a lot more that that. This is two legendary swashbucklers and they're in their prime, it's Burt Lancaster in "The Crimson Pirate" battling Errol Flynn in "Robin Hood" and then, incredibly, the action begins going even faster than before as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (happy as a clam) You are wonderful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you -- I've worked hard to become so. The Cliff edge is very close now. Inigo is continually being forced toward it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I admit it -- you are better than I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why are you smiling? Inches from defeat, Inigo is, in fact, all smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I know something you don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what is that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not left-handed. And he throws the six-fingered sword into his right hand and immediately, the tide of battle turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A ROCKY STAIRCASE leading to a turret-shaped plateau, and the Man In Black is retreating like mad up the steps and he can't stop Inigo -- nothing can stop Inigo -- and in a frenzy, the Man In Black makes every feint, tries every thrust, lets go with all he has left. But he fails. Everything fails. He tries one or two final desperate moves but they are nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're amazing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ought to be after twenty years. And now the Man In Black is smashed into a stone pillar, pinned there under the six fingered sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hollering it out) There's something I ought to tell you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am not left-handed either. And now he changes hands, and at last, the battle is fully joined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He dives to the bar, swings completely over it like a circus performer and dismounts with a backflip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one of consequence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get used to disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE SIX-FINGERED SWORD as it is knocked free, arching up into the air, and -- CUT TO: INIGO catching it again. And something terrible is written behind his eyes: he has given his all, done everything man can do, tried every style, made every maneuver, but it wasn't enough, and on his face for all to see is the realization that he, Inigo Montoya of Spain, is going to lose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill me quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would as soon destroy a stained glass window as an artist like yourself. However, since I can't have you following me either -- And he dunks Inigo's head with his heavy sword handle. Inigo pitches forward unconscious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please understand, I hold you in the highest respect. He grabs his scabbard and takes off after the Princess and we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PULL BACK TO REVEAL Vizzini, staring down from a narrow mountain path, as far below the Man In Black can be seen running. FEZZIK, carrying the Princess, stands alongside. It's a little later in the morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give her to me. (grabs Buttercup starts off) Catch up with us quickly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (starting to panic) What do I do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finish him, finish him. Your way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, good, my way. Thank you, Vizzini. (little pause) Which way is my way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick up one of those rocks, get behind the boulder, and in a few minutes, the Man in Black will come running around the bend. The minute his head is in view, hit it with the rock! As Vizzini and Buttercup hurry away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (little frown; softly) My way's not very sportsmanlike. He grabs one of the rocks and plods behind the boulder and we -- DISSOLVE TO: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE MAN IN BLACK racing up the mountain trail. Ahead is a bend in the trail. He sees it, slows. Then he stops, listening. Satisfied by the silence, he starts forward again and as he rounds the bend -- a rock flies INTO FRAME, shattering on a boulder inches in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did that on purpose. I don't have to miss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I believe you -- So what happens now?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We face each other as God intended. Sportsmanlike. No tricks, no weapons, skill against skill alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, you'll put down your rock and I'll put down my sword, and we'll try to kill each other like civilized people?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gently) I could kill you now. He gets set to throw, but the Man In Black shakes his head, takes off his sword and scabbard, begins the approach toward the Giant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frankly, I think the odds are slightly in your favor at hand fighting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not my fault being the biggest and the strongest. I don't even exercise. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He flips the rock away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look are you just fiddling around with me or what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just want you to feel you're doing well. I hate for people to die embarrassed. They get set to begin again. Then suddenly -- CUT TO: FEZZIK as he jumps forward with stunning speed for anyone his size and reaches for the Man In Black who drops to his knees, spins loose, and slips between the Giant's legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're quick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a good thing too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting set for another onslaught) Why do you wear a mask? Were you burned by acid, or something like that? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no. It's just that they're terribly comfortable. I think everyone will be wearing them in the future. FEZZIK considers this a moment, then attacks, and if he moved quickly last time, this time he is blinding and as the Man In Black slips down to avoid the charge, FEZZIK moves right with him, only instead of twisting free and jumping to his feet, this time the Man In Black jumps for FEZZIK's back and in a moment he is riding him, and his arms have FEZZIK's throat, locked across FEZZIK's windpipe, one in front, one behind. The Man In Black begins to squeeze. Tighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (standing, talking as he does so) I just figured out why you give me so much trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (his arms never leave Fezzik's throat) Why is that, do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (his voice just beginning to get a little strained) Well, I haven't fought just one person for so long. I've been specializing in groups. Battling gangs for local charities, that kind of thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANOTHER HUGE ROCK ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE PATH Again FEZZIK charges, slower this time, but still a charge, and again he spins and creams the Man In Black against the rough boulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why should that make such a difference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well ... (And now his voice is definitely growing weaker) ... you see, you use different moves when you're fighting half a dozen people than when you only have to be worried about one. Again FEZZIK slams the Man In Black against a boulder, only this time his power has diminished and Fezzik starts to slowly collapse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't envy you the headache you will have when you awake. But, in the meantime, rest well ... and dream of large women. And he nimbly scoops up his sword with his foot, catches it and as he dashes off up along the mountain path -- CUT TO: PRINCE HUMPERDINCK as he slips his boot into a foot print in the sand. Count Rugen mounted, watches. Behind him, half a dozen armed WARRIORS, also mounted. A GREAT WHITE HORSE waits riderless in front. Humperdinck is all over the rocky ground, and maybe he isn't the best hunter in the world. Then again, maybe he is. Because, as he begins to put his feet into strange positions, we realize that what he is doing is miming the fencers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a mighty duel -- it ranged all over. They were both masters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who won? How did it end?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking down in the position where Inigo fell unconscious) The loser ran off alone. (points in the direction Vizzini and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: took) The winner followed those footprints toward Guilder!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we track them both?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The loser is nothing. -- Only the Princess matters -- (to the armed warriors)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO And behind him now, drawing closer all the time, is the deadly edge of the Cliffs of Insanity. Inigo fights and ducks and feints and slashes and it all works, but not for long, as gradually the Man In Black keeps the advantage, keeps forcing Inigo back, closer and closer to death. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK stunned, doing everything be can to keep Inigo by the Cliff edge. But no use. Slowly at first, he begins to retreat. Now faster, Inigo is in control and the Man In Black is desperate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO and the six-fingered sword is all but invisible now, as he increases his attack, then suddenly switches styles again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO And to his amazement, he is being forced back down the steps. He tries one style, another, but it all comes down to the same thing -- the Man In Black seems to be in control. And before Inigo knows it, the six-fingered sword is knocked clear out of his hand. Inigo retreats, dives from the stairs to a moss-covered bar suspended over the archway. He swings out, lands, and scrambles to his sword and we
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK who watches Inigo, then casually tosses his sword to the landing where it sticks in perfectly. Then the Man In Black copies INIGO. Not copies exactly, improves. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO staring in awe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : INIGO moving like lightning, and he thrusts forward, slashes, darts back, all in almost a single movement and -- CUT TO: THE MAN IN BLACK Dodging, blocking, and again he thrusts forward, faster even than before, and again he slashes but -- CUT TO: INIGO And there is never a move anyone makes he doesn't remember, and this time he blocks the slash, slashes out himself with the sixfingered sword. On it goes, back and forth across the rocky terrain, Inigo's feet moving with the grace and speed of a great improvisational dancer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK moving in for the end now, blocking everything, muzzling everything and
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE SIX-FINGERED SWORD sent flying from Inigo's grip. He stands helpless only a moment. Then be drops to his knees, bows his head, shuts his eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : CLOSE UP: VIZZINI VIZZINI
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : A COUPLE OF ROCKS Nothing gigantic. Vizzini points to them. There is a large boulder nearby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : FEZZIK He moves into the mountain path. He has picked up another rock and holds it lightly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: MOUNTAIN PATH AND THE TWO MEN

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MOUNTAIN PATH AND THE TWO MEN The Man In Black is not now and has never been a shrimp. But it's like he wasn't even there, FEZZIK towers over him so much. There is a moment's pause, and then the Man In Black dives at FEZZIK's chest, slams him several tremendous blows in the stomach, twists his arm severely, slips skillfully into a beautifully applied bear hug, and in general makes any number of terrific wrestling moves. FEZZIK just stands there, kind of taking in the scenery. Finally the Man In Black pushes himself away, stares up at the Giant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : FEZZIK as he charges toward a huge rock that lines the path, and just as he reaches it he spins his giant body so that the entire weight of the charge is taken by the Man In Black.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK And the power of the charge is terrible, the pain enormous, but he clings to his grip at FEZZIK's windpipe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK And the punishment is terrible, and for a moment it seems as if he is going to let go of Fezzik's windpipe and crumble, but he doesn't, he holds on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : FEZZIK and there isn't much breath coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK holding his grip as FEZZIK tries to stand, halfway makes it, but there is no air. Back to his knees he falls, holds there for a moment, and pitches down to all fours. The Man In Black increases the pressure. FEZZIK tries to crawl. But there is just no air. No air. FEZZIK goes to earth and lies still.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : FEZZIK as the Man In Black turns him over, puts his ear to FEZZIK's heart. It beats. The Man In Black stands. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: clearly this was all planned by warriors of Guilder. We must be ready for whatever lies ahead. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could this be a trap?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (vaulting onto his horse) I always think everything could be a trap -- Which is why I'm still alive. And he gallops off -- CUT TO: THE MAN IN BLACK cresting the peak of the mountain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, it is down to you. And it is down to me. The Man In Black nods and comes nearer -- VIZZINI If you wish her dead, by all means keep moving forward. And he pushes his long knife harder against Buttercup's unprotected throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me explain-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: there's nothing to explain. You're trying to kidnap what I've rightfully stolen. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perhaps an arrangement can be reached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There will be no arrangement -- (deliberate)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : CLOSE-UP ON a knife pointed at a throat -- PULL BACK TO REVEAL Vizzini munching on an apple, holding the knife to Buttercup's throat. She is blindfolded. A PICNIC SPREAD is laid out. A tablecloth, two goblets and between them, a small leather wine container. And some cheese and a couple of apples. The picnic is set on a lovely spot, high on the edge of a mountain path with a view all the way back to the sea. The Man In Black comes running around the path, sees Vizzini, slows. The two men study each other. Then -- VIZZINI
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and you're killing her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if there can be no arrangement, then we are at an impasse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid so -- I can't compete with you physically. And you're no match for my brains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're that smart?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me put it this way: have you ever heard of Plato, Aristotle, Socrates?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? In that case, I challenge you to a battle of wits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the death? Another nod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I accept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Then pour the wine. As Vizzini fills the goblets with the dark red liquid, the Man In Black pulls a small packet from his clothing, handing it to Vizzini.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inhale this, but do not touch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (doing it) I smell nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (taking the packet back) What you do not smell is called iocane powder. It is odorless, tasteless, dissolves instantly in liquid, and is among the more deadlier poisons known to man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right: where is the poison? The battle of wits has begun. It ends when you decide and we both drink, and find out who is right and who is dead. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's so simple. All I have to do is divine from what I know of you. Are you the sort of man who would put the poison into his own goblet, or his enemy's? He studies the Man In Black now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, a clever man would put the poison into his own goblet, because he would know that only a great fool would reach for what he was given. I'm not a great fool, so I can clearly not choose the wine in front of you. But you must have known I was not a great fool; you would have counted on it, so I can clearly not choose the wine in front of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (And now there's a trace of nervousness beginning) You've made your decision then7
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not remotely. Because iocane comes from Australia, as everyone knows. And Australia is entirely peopled with criminals. And criminals are used to having people not trust them, as you are not trusted by me. So I can clearly not choose the wine in front of you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Truly, you have a dizzying intellect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait till I get going! Where was I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Australia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes -- Australia, and you must have suspected I would have known the powder's origin, so I can clearly not choose the wine in front of me. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (very nervous) You're just stalling now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cackling) You'd like to think that, wouldn't you? (stares at the Man in Black) You've beaten my giant, which means you're exceptionally strong. So, you could have put the poison in your own goblet, trusting on your strength to save you. So I can clearly not choose the wine in front of you. But, you've also bested my Spaniard which means you must have studied. And in studying, you must have learned that man is mortal so you would have put the poison as far from yourself as possible, so I can clearly not choose the wine in front of me. As Vizzini's pleasure has been growing throughout, the Man In Black's has been fast disappearing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're trying to trick me into giving away something -- it won't work -- VIZZINI (triumphant) It has worked -- you've given everything away -- I know where the poison is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (fool's courage) Then make your choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. And I choose -- And suddenly he stops, points at something behind the Man In Black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: what in the world can that be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE MAN IN BLACK turning around, looking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Where? I don't see anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, well, I-I could have sworn I saw something. No matter. The Man In Black turns to face him again. Vizzini starts to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's so funny?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell you in a minute. First, let's drink -- me from my glass, and you from yours. And he picks up his goblet. The Man In Black picks up the one in front of him. As they both start to drink, Vizzini hesitates a moment. Then, allowing the Man In Black to drink first, he swallows his wine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guessed wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (roaring with laughter) You only think I guessed wrong -- (louder now)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP'S THROAT as Vizzini jabs with his long knife. Buttercup gasps against the pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK stopping fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : VIZZINI watching excitedly as the Man In Black takes the goblets, turns his back. A moment later, he turns again, faces Vizzini, drops the iocane packet. It is now empty. The Man In Black rotates the goblets in a little shell game maneuver then puts one glass in front of Vizzini, the other in front of himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : VIZZINI busily switching the goblets while the Man In Black has his head turned.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: that's what's so funny! I switched glasses when your back was turned. You fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . VIZZINI watching him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fell victim to one of the classic blunders. The most famous is "Never get involved in a land war in Asia." But only slightly less well known is this: "Never go in against a Sicilian when death is on the line." He laughs and roars and cackles and whoops and is in all ways quite cheery until he falls over dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am no one to be trifled with, that is all you ever need know. He starts to lead her off the mountain path into untraveled terrain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a final glance back toward Vizzini) To think -- all that time it was your cup that was poisoned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were both poisoned. I spent the last few years building up an immunity to iocane powder. And with that, he takes off, dragging her behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A MOUNTAIN PATH It's where FEZZIK fought the Man in Black. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL the Prince, kneeling, inspecting every grain of misplaced sand. The others wait behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone has beaten a giant! (roaring) There will be great suffering in Guilder if she dies. He leaps onto his horse and they charge off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (his voice harsh now, carrying the promise of violence) Catch your breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'll release me ... whatever you ask for ransom ... you'll get it, I promise you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what is that worth, the promise of a woman? You're very funny, Highness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was giving you a chance. No matter where you take me ... there's no greater hunter than Prince Humperdinck. He could track a falcon on a cloudy day. He can find you
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never said he was my dearest love. And yes, he will save me. That I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You admit to me you do not love your fiance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows I do not love him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Are not capable of love" is what you mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have loved more deeply than a killer like yourself could ever dream. And the Man In Black cocks back a fist. Buttercup flinches, but does not retreat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a warning, Highness. The next time, my hand flies on its own. For where I come from, there are penalties when a woman lies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Iocane. I'd bet my life on it. (gestures to the trail ahead) And there are the Princess's footprints. She is alive ... or was, an hour ago. If she is otherwise when I find her, I shall be very put out. And as he vaults onto his horse and the all charge off -- CUT TO: ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BUTTERCUP being spun INTO CAMERA view, falling heavily as the Man In Black releases her. We are at the edge of an almost sheer ravine. The drop is sharp and severe. Below, the ravine floor is flat, but getting there would not be half the fun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest, Highness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stares at him) I know who you are -- your cruelty reveals everything. The Man In Black says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the Dread Pirate Roberts; admit it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bowing) With pride. What can I do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can die slowly cut into a thousand pieces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardly complimentary, Your Highness. Why loose your venom on me? CLOSE UP - BUTTERCUP, quietly now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You killed my love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's possible; I kill a lot of people. Who was this love of yours? Another Prince, like this one, ugly, rich, and scabby? ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. A farm boy. Poor. Poor and perfect, with eyes like the sea after a storm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the high seas, your ship attacked, and the Dread Pirate Roberts never takes prisoners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (explaining as a teacher might) I can't afford to make exceptions. Once word leaks out that a pirate has gone soft, people begin to disobey you, and then it's nothing but work, work, work, all the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mock my pain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Life is pain, Highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something. I remember this farm boy of yours, I think. This would be, what, five years ago? Buttercup nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it bother you to hear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing you can say will upset me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He died well, that should please you. No bribe attempts or blubbering. He simply said, "Please. Please, I need to live." It was the "please" that caught my memory. (MORE) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I asked him what was so important for him. "True love," he replied. And then he spoke of a girl of surpassing beauty and faithfulness. I can only assume he meant you. You should bless me for destroying him before he found out what you really are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Faithfulness he talked of, madam. Your enduring faithfulness. Now, tell me truly. When you found out he was gone, did you get engaged to your prince that same hour, or did you wait a whole week out of respect for the dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mocked me once, never do it again -- I died that day! The Man In Black is about to reply as they stand there on the edge of the sheer ravine. But then something catches his attention and as he stares at it briefly,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can die too, for all I care!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Down, down, rolling, spinning, crashing always down toward the flat rock floor of the ravine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... as ... you ... wish...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my sweet Westley; what have I done? And without a second thought or consideration of the dangers, she starts into the ravine. A moment later, she too is falling, spinning and twisting, crashing and torn, cartwheeling down toward what is left of her beloved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Disappeared. He must have seen us closing in, which might account for his panicking in error. Unless I'm wrong, and I am never wrong, they are headed dead into the fire swamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE RAVINE FLOOR TWO BODIES lie a few feet apart, not moving. It is, of course, Buttercup and Westley. They might be corpses. After a time, Westley slowly forces his body into motion and as he does,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you move at all?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly stretching out an arm toward him) Move? You're alive. If you want, I can fly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you, "I would always come for you." Why didn't you wait for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well ... you were dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death cannot stop true love. All it can do is delay it for a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will never doubt again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There will never be a need. And now, they begin to kiss; it's a tender kiss, tender and loving and gentle and -- THE KID (off-screen) Oh no. No, please.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're kissing again, do we have to hear the kissing part?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someday, you may not mind so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip on to the Fire Swamp -- that sounded good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. You're sick, I'll humor you. (he picks up the book again) So now, where were we here? Yeah, yeah, yeah. Ah. Oh. Okay. Westley and Buttercup raced along the ravine floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ha. Your pig fiance is too late. A few more steps and we'll be safe in the Fire Swamp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll never survive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . As they race off, leaving Humperdinck and his men stranded, defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not that bad. I'm not saying I'd like to build a summer home here, but the trees are actually quite lovely. THE GIANT TREES, thick and black-green, look ominous as hell and they shield all but intermittent stripes of sun. A GIANT SPURT OF FLAME leaps up, preceded by a slight popping sound, and this particular spurt of flame misses Westley, but Buttercup is suddenly onfire; at least the lower half of her is and -- CUT TO: WESTLEY instantly forcing Buttercup to sit, gathering her flaming hem in his hands, doing his best to suffocate the fire. This isn't all that easy and it causes him a bit of grief, but he does his best to sound as jaunty as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well now, that was an adventure. He examines where the flames burst over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Singed a bit, were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He was, and he shakes his head "no." As he pulls her to her feet -- CUT TO: THE SWAMP FLOOR -- and as there's another popping sound,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, one thing I will say. The Fire Swamp certainly does keep you on your toes. Buttercup is frozen with fear. He takes her hand, gently leads her forward as we-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (happily) This will all soon be but a happy memory because Roberts' ship "Revenge" is anchored at the far end. And I, as you know, am Roberts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But how is that possible, since he's been marauding twenty years and you only left me five years ago?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There is again a popping sound, then a huge spurt of flame. Westley simply picks up Buttercup as they walk along, moves her out of danger, puts her back down, goes right on talking without missing a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, what I told you before about saying "please" was true. It intrigued Roberts, as did my descriptions of your beauty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, Roberts decided something. He said, "All right, Westley, I've never had a valet. You can try it for tonight. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." Three years he said that. "Good night, Westley. Good work. Sleep well. I'll most likely kill you in the morning." It was a fine time for me. I was learning to fence, to fight, anything anyone would teach me. And Roberts and I eventually became friends. And then it happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? -- go on -- Westley picks her up, carrying her across some swamp water that is bridged by a narrow, rickety tree branch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Roberts had grown so rich, he wanted to retire. So he took me to his cabin and told me his secret. "I am not the Dread Pirate Roberts," he said. "My name is Ryan. I inherited this ship from the previous Dread Pirate Roberts, just as you will inherit it from me. The man I inherited it from was not the real Dread Pirate Roberts, either. (MORE) ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name was Cummerbund. The real Roberts has been retired fifteen years and living like a king in Patagonia." Then he explained the name was the important thing for inspiring the necessary fear. You see, no one would surrender to the Dread Pirate Westley. The two of them have by now crossed the pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we sailed ashore, took on an entirely new crew and he stayed aboard for awhile as first mate, all the time calling me Roberts. Once the crew believed, he left the ship and I have been Roberts ever since. Except, now that we're together, I shall retire and hand the name over to someone else. Is everything clear to you? Buttercup, perplexed, is about to reply but the ground she steps on gives way -- it's Lightning Sand -- a great patch of it, and it has her -- a cloud of powder rises and she sinks into the stuff crying Westley's name but then she is gone as we -- CUT TO: WESTLEY WHIRLING slashing at a U-shaped vine, hacks it in half -- it's still connected to the tree. Then be grabs it, drops his sword, and, clutching the other end of the vine, he dives into the lightning sand and there is another cloud of white powder, but it settles quickly. Now nothing can be seen. Nothing at all. Just the lightning sand, lovely and lethal. HOLD ON THE LIGHTNING SAND -- THEN -- An odd panting sound is heard now. The panting sound is suddenly very loud. And then a giant R.0.U.S. darts into view. The R.0.U.S. -- a Rodent of Unusual Size -- is probably no more than eighty pounds of bone and power. It sniffs around a bit then, as quickly as it has come, it goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . THE LIGHTNING SAND as Westley, lungs long past the bursting point, explodes out; he has Buttercup across his shoulders and as he pulls to the edge of the lightning sand pit, using the vine -- CUT TO: CLOSE-UP - BUTTERCUP Her face is caked with the white powder. It is in her eyes, her ears, hair, mouth. She's still probably beautiful, but you have to look awfully hard to see it. As Westley continues to pull them to safety -- CUT TO: THE R.0.U.S. high above them; it watches -- CUT TO: BUTTERCUP placed against a tree. Westley is cleaning the lightning sand from her face. He hesitates, glances around and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll never succeed -- we may as well die here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No. We have already succeeded. He glances back again. Now THERE ARE TWO R.0.U.S.'s. The have climbed into a nearby tree, stare hungrily down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, what are the three terrors of the Fire Swamp? One, the flame spurts. No problem. There's a popping sound preceding each, we can avoid that. Two, the Lightning Sand. But you were clever enough to discover what that looks like, so in the future we can avoid that too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Westley, what about the R.O.U.S.'s?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rodents of Unusual Size? I don't think they exist... And as he says that, a R.0.U.S. comes flying at him from offscreen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Westley! Westley abandons his sword, reaching for the rodent, grabbing only a tail, wrestling with it. Buttercup grabs a small branch, and using it as a club, beats the skull of the thing, doing pretty well, but the beast manages to snag her hem with its razor teeth, and she's pulled to the ground, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WESTLEY jumping onto its back, and the R.0.U.S. is all over him now, sinking needle teeth into Westley's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost in disbelief) We did it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . And from somewhere they summon strength, pick up their pace, and as they reach the edge of the Fire Swamp -- CUT TO: SOMETHING WE HADN'T EXPECTED: Humperdinck on his horse, Rugen beside him. THREE WARRIORS, armed and ready, are mounted in formation behind. Buttercup and Westley are at the edge of the Fire Swamp, about to leave it. They stop. Buttercup looks beyond exhaustion. Westley looks worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surrender! It's dusk. Behind Humperdinck are the waters of the bay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean you wish to surrender to me? Very well, I accept.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I give you full marks for bravery --don't make yourself a fool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but how will you capture us? We know the secrets of the Fire Swamp. We can live there quite happily for some time. So, whenever you feel like dying, feel free to visit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you once again -- surrender!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will not happen!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AN ARMED WARRIOR in shadow, with a loaded crossbow aimed at Westley's heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (roaring) For the last time -- SURRENDER!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (roaring right back, bigger)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK There's nothing he can say. He just sits there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK stepping past the corpse, taking the blindfold and bindings off Buttercup, who notices Vizzini lying dead. The Man In Black pulls her to her feet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : A WILD STRETCH OF TERRAIN The Man In Black comes running into view, still dragging Buttercup, who sometimes stumbles, but he keeps forcing her along. Finally, when she is close to exhaustion, he lets go of her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : VIZZINI'S BODY The picnic is spread as before. CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL the Prince kneeling by the body as the others ride up. The Prince grabs the empty poison packet, hands it to Rugen, after first sniffing it himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK watching her closely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP And probably, if she did not hate Roberts so, there would be tears.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : HIS P.O.V.: The dust cloud caused by Humperdinck's HORSES is rising up into the sky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP and while his attention is on the dust cloud, rising high, she pushes him with all the strength she has.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE MAN IN BLACK teetering on the ravine edge, for a moment, then he begins to fall. Down goes the Man In Black. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP staring transfixed at what she has wrought. There is a long pause. She stands there, alone, as from far below the words come to her, drifting on the wind -- MAN IN BLACK
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE DUST CLOUD rising. PULL BACK TO REVEAL Prince Humperdinck and the others reining in at the spot where Buttercup promised ransom in exchange for her freedom. The Prince shakes his head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : COUNT RUGEN The mere mention of the Fire Swamp makes him pale.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP bruised and torn, as Westley crawls slowly toward her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE KID'S BEDROOM GRANDFATHER
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY AND BUTTERCUP racing along the ravine floor. Westley glances up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : HUMPERDINCK AND HIS MEN perched on top of the cliff, looking down at Westley and Buttercup.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP and Westley has tried to say it with Chevalier-like nonchalance, but she ain't buying.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE FIRE SWAMP And it really doesn't look any worse than any other moist, sulphurous, infernal horror you might run across. Great trees block the sun.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY AND BUTTERCUP Buttercup is clearly panicked and maybe Westley is too, but he moves jauntily along, sword in hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY GRABBING BUTTERCUP pulling her aside to safety as another great spun of flame suddenly shoots up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE TWO OF THEM moving slowly along through a particularly dangerous part of the Fire Swamp. It's later now, the sun slants down at a slightly different angle.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : SOME HIDEOUS VINES -- they look like they could be flesh eating. Westley takes his sword, slices a path for them to follow. The vines groan as they fall. He's been chatting away the entire time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : THE R.0.U.S. on a much lower branch now. It stares down at Westley. Westley stares back up at the beast. Buttercup is oblivious. Her eyes flutter. He continues to work on her as -- BUTTERCUP
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY, picking her up. He puts an arm around her, starts to walk with her as he encouragingly goes on talking. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP screaming and -- Westley, pinned under the attacking R.0.U.S., trying to fend it off. Can't. The thing's teeth sink deep into his arm. He howls. Westley drives a fist into the beast's face, rolling it off. He reaches for his sword just a few feet away, but the R.0.U.S. is back atop him. It's a fierce battle, and just when we think Westley can't possibly win, he flips the ugly rodent clear. Westley scrambles for his sword. The R.0.U.S. stampedes on, changing its target, heading right for -- Buttercup, and she's scared to death and -- BUTTERCUP
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : WESTLEY with death close at hand, as a popping sound starts. He tries one desperate move, rolls into the sound -- CUT TO: A FLAME SPURT shooting skyward and -- CUT TO: WESTLEY with the R.0.U.S. pinned under him, and as the beast bursts into flame, it lets go and Westley rolls safely free, grabs his sword and exhaustedly stabs the R.0.U.S., which is trying to put itself out. The R.0.U.S. collapses dead. Westley stands motionless, exhausted. The danger has passed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP relieved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP looking the other way -- CUT TO: ANOTHER WARRIOR crossbow aimed at Westley.

direction.raw_text: Will you promise not to hurt him?

direction.raw_text: What was that?

direction.raw_text: What was that?

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I live a thousand years and never hunt again.

direction.raw_text: (looks at Westley) He is a sailor on the pirate ship "Revenge." Promise to return him to his ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I swear it will be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispering) Once we're out of sight, take him back to Florin and throw him in the Pit of Despair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (almost a smile) I swear it will be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you were dead once, and it almost destroyed me. I could not bear it if you died again, not when I could save you. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Westley is dazed. Silent. Buttercup tries to speak again, can't, and is swooped off her feet onto Humperdinck's horse, and off they go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, sir. We must get you to your ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are men of action. Lies do not become us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well spoken, sir -- Westley is looking at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: what is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have six fingers on your right hand -- someone was looking for you -- Count Rugen clubs Westley hard across the skull. Westley starts to fall --the screen goes black. FADE IN ON: THE PIT OF DESPAIR Dank and chill, underground and windowless, lit by flickering torches. Frightening. Westley lies in the center of the cage, chained and helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he only whispers) The Pit of Despair. He begins tending Westley's wounds. Westley winces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (garbled) Don't even think -- (A hack, sputter, cough - now his voice seems normal again)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : HUMPERDINCK whirling to face her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP talking to them both.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : BUTTERCUP AND WESTLEY staring deep into each other's eyes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : SOMETHING REALLY FRIGHTENING: A BLOODLESS-LOOKING ALBINO Dead pale, he silently enters the pit, carrying a tray of food and medication. He puts it down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: don't even think about trying to escape. The chains are far too thick. And don't dream of being rescued either. The only way in is secret. And only the Prince, the Count, and I know how to get in and out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'm here till I die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (working away) Till they kill you. Yeah.

direction.raw_text: Then why bother curing me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Prince and the Count always insist on everyone being healthy before they're broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it's to be torture. The albino nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can cope with torture. The albino shakes his head.

direction.raw_text: You don't believe me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You survived the Fire Swamp. You must be very brave... (little pause) ... but nobody withstands The Machine. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

direction.raw_text: . He studies Westley, whose face is almost sad.

direction.raw_text: She's been like that ever since the Fire Swamp. (looks at Rugen) It's my father's failing health that's upsetting her.

direction.raw_text: (unbelieving) Of course. As they move on--

direction.raw_text: (off-screen)

dialogue.raw_text: : MAIN SQUARE OF FLORIN CASTLE And if we thought it was packed before, we didn't know how many more could fit in this courtyard. Humperdinck, Rugen and the Queen stand high on the balcony. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

direction.raw_text: hold it. Hold it, Grandpa. And the scene FREEZES, Humperdinck caught in mid-sentence.

direction.raw_text: You read that wrong. She doesn't marry Humperdinck, she marries Westley. I'm just sure of it. After all that Westley did for her, if she does not marry him, it wouldn't be fair.

direction.raw_text: Well, who says life is fair? Where is that written? Life isn't always fair.
